title: Altair: Using the Powerful Vega-Lite 'Grammar of Graphics
description: Using the Altair library for Python we can develop compelling data visualizations based on a grammar of graphics and implement them in Streamlit

title: Data Visualization, Data Science and Python
description: Subscribe to my newsletter on Substack

title: How to Use the Powerful New Assistants API for Data Analyst
description: OpenAI’s Assistants API lets us create AI assistants which leverage tools that can operate on user-provided data

title: How to Create a Simple GIS Map with Plotly and Streamlit
description: Plotly map functions combined with Streamlit user interface components provide a way of creating GIS-style dashboards

description: Build a data visualisation web page with Plotly and Flask, and make it interactive with some UI components

title: Data Visualization on the Web with Plotly and PyScript
description: Put your data visualisations on the web with HTML templates — no server-side code required

title: A New Plotly Component for Streamlit
description: Streamlit only supports two Plotly themes: the Streamlit theme, or the default Plotly theme. We present a Streamlit component that will you to display Plotly charts more flexibly.

title: 2023 was the Hottest Summer Ever
description: We look at how to visualize the hottest-ever recorded temperatures over the period of June through August 2023

title: How to Build Waterfall Charts with Plotly Graph Objects
description: Plotly Express doesn't implement waterfall charts but we can create a helper function that utilises Plotly Graph Objects instead

title: Streamlit and MongoDB: Storing Your Data in the Cloud
description: Deploying your Streamlit app to the Cloud means that any data that you create with that app disappears when the app terminates - unless you use third-party storage like the NoSQL database MongoDB

title: Using Streamlit’s Chat Elements: the Doctor is in
description: We use Streamlit’s chat elements to reproduce the famous 1960s Rogerian-psychologist-bot ELIZA

title: Simple Surveys with Streamlit
description: Streamlit’s user interface components made constructing simple surveys easy. We create a simple survey with Streamlit, present it and show the results.

title: Visualizing 'Brexit Regret' Data
description: A recent poll shows that more Britons favour rejoining the EU than those who still support Brexit. Let’s draw some graphs.

title: Build a Web App with Jupyter and Mercury
description: Mercury provides a simple way to transform Jupyter Notebooks into interactive web apps.

title: How to Publish Your Jupyter Notebook Apps with Mercury Cloud
description: Convert your Notebooks to web apps then publish them in the cloud.

title: ChatGPT Prompting for Coders: a Prototyping Approach
description: A suitable prompting technique can make the development of usable code with ChatGPT quite painless. Here we prototype a Streamlit app for tracking cryptocurrency.

title: ChatGPT-like AI Could Replace the Equivalent of 300m Workers
description: A new Goldman Sachs report will be scary reading for some.

title: How I used ChatGPT to Build a Streamlit Dashboard App
description: Using CO² emission data I created a dashboard app in Streamlit with ChatGPT and no coding

title: Will ChatGPT Kill Open Source and Is It Even Legal?
description: Time and a lawsuit will tell but there is a large question mark over generative AI and its use of copyrighted material

title: What’s new in PyScript in 2023
description: Since I last wrote about PyScrypt there have been two updates — versions 2022.09.1 and 2022.12.1 — and we no longer seem to be in alpha territory.

title: The Art of Statistics: How to Learn from Data
description: In this 'important and comprehensive' guide to statistical thinking (New Yorker), discover how data literacy is changing the world and gives you a better understanding of life’s biggest problems. - I have used this book in various articles and found it to be invaluable.

title: Data Analysis with ChatGPT and Jupyter Notebooks
description: The conversational way of generating code with ChatGPT works well with the cell structure of Jupyter Notebooks. There is a natural workflow when using ChatGPT with Jupyter Notebooks which makes generating a code for a Jupyter Notebook using ChatGPT surprisingly easy and satisfying.

title: Streamlit from Scratch
description: Find the tools you need and use them to create your first interactive web app in Python and Streamlit. Add media to your apps to help to communicate your ideas, produce text figures, tables and sophisticated charts from Pandas dataframes using Matplotlib, Plotly, Altair and other libraries. Finally, use the UI and layout features of Streamlit to create data dashboard apps.

title: Streamlit Text Gets Colourful
description: Your Streamlit text no longer has to be boring. Version 1.16 lets you colour markdown text.

title: Organize Your Data Science Projects with PPDAC - a Case Study
description: Define your problem, develop a plan, find the data, analyze the data and then communicate your conclusions - that's PPDAC

title: CO2 Emissions Infographics in Python
description: How To Build a Data Infographics with Python and Matplotlib

title: Storytelling with Data: A Data Visualization Guide for Business
description: Don't simply show your data—tell a story with it!  Storytelling with Data teaches you the fundamentals of data visualization and how to communicate effectively with data. I use this excellent book in the series of articles '12 Essential Visualizations and How to Implement them.

title: 12 Essential Visualizations and How to Implement Them - part 1
description: We look at how to create the 12 most useful graphs and charts with Python, Matplotlib and Streamlit.

description: We look at how to create the 12 most useful graphs and charts with Python, Matplotlib and Streamlit.

title: NASA Open APIs: The Astronomy Picture of the Day in Streamlit

description: We present a method to programmatically create a grid layout in Streamlit with a World population data demonstration app

title: PyScript v. Flask: How to Create a Python App in the Browser or on a Server

description: PyScript doesn’t support Plotly directly but there is a simple way around it

description: Streamlit has a limited layout model and this is normally an advantage as it allows the simple construction of sophisticated apps. But sometimes you want to modify the layout.

title: Mean, Median and Mode: What Are They and When Should You Use Them?

description: A leading data visualization expert explores the negative―and positive―influences that charts have on our perception of truth. I used this book as the inspiration for 'How Not to Lie with Charts'

description: Pluto is an important development that allows you to easily interact with your data. We take a quick look at it using the Julia plotting package to easily create impressive graphs.

Do you wish that Python could emulate the superb visualizations that ggplot gives you in the R language? Well it can.
